title: Arrow's single peaked domains, richness, and domains for plurality and the Borda count. (arXiv:2401.12547v1 [econ.TH])
abstract: In this paper we extend the study of Arrow's generalisation of Black's single-peaked domain and connect this to domains where voting rules satisfy different versions of independence of irrelevant alternatives.  First we report on a computational generation of all non-isomorphic Arrow's single-peaked domains on $n\leq 9$ alternatives. Next, we introduce a quantitative measure of richness for domains, as the largest number $r$ such that every alternative is given every rank between 1 and $r$ by the orders in the domain. We investigate the richness of Arrow's single-peaked domains and prove that Black's single-peaked domain has the highest possible richness, but it is not the only domain which attains the maximum.  After this we connect Arrow's single-peaked domains to the discussion by Dasgupta, Maskin and others of domains on which plurality and the Borda count satisfy different versions of Independence of Irrelevant alternatives (IIA). translated_title: Arrow的单峰域，丰富度以及多数制和博达计数的域
translated_abstract: 在这篇论文中，我们扩展了Arrow对Black的单峰域的广义研究，并将其与满足不同版本无关替代的投票规则的域相连。首先，我们报告了在$n\leq 9$个备选方案的所有非同构Arrow的单峰域的计算生成。接下来，我们引入了域的丰富度的定量度量，定义为在该域中每个备选方案都被赋予1到$r$之间的所有等级。我们研究了Arrow的单峰域的丰富度，并证明了Black的单峰域具有最大可能的丰富度，但它不是唯一达到最大值的域。然后，我们将Arrow的单峰域与Dasgupta，Maskin和其他人关于多数制和博达计数满足不同版本无关替代的讨论相连。
tldr: 这篇论文扩展了Arrow的单峰域的研究，研究了其丰富度，并将其与满足不同版本无关替代的投票规则的域相连。
en_tdlr: This paper extends the study of Arrow's single-peaked domain, explores its richness, and connects it to domains where voting rules satisfy different versions of independence of irrelevant alternatives.
